conversation.content: Sorry to bother you but... what's the word... my account balance. It says zero?

Oh wow, okay, let me pull that up for you right away—zero balance, that's definitely not right. *sharp inhale* So I'm looking at account ending in 4792, and yeah, I see exactly what you're seeing here, which is, frankly, alarming because this shouldn't happen.
I know it's not your fault. There was... um... fifteen hundred in there yesterday.

No no, you're absolutely right to be concerned about this—I mean, I'd be freaking out too if my balance just vanished. Let me check the transaction history here, uh, starting from yesterday at 11:59 PM... okay so there's a debit for exactly $1,547.82 marked as "system adjustment," which honestly makes zero sense.
System adjustment? That's what they said last time. About the... er... the recurring fee thing.

Wait, this happened before? *exhales* Okay that's—sorry, I mean that's completely unacceptable. Let me look at your case history... hmm, I see ticket #TK-8829-QX from last month about unauthorized deductions, and it shows resolved but clearly, um, something's still broken in our system.
Look I just... I need that money. Rent's due tomorrow.

Absolutely, we're fixing this today—not tomorrow, today. So what I'm doing right now is, uh, initiating an emergency reversal for transaction ID RV-1547-82-XKL, and normally this takes 3-5 days but—no wait, that's not gonna work for you—let me escalate this differently.
Three to five days? They promised me... what was it... immediate resolution last time.

Yeah I know, those timeline promises are, frankly, ridiculous when people have real bills to pay. *sharp breath* Alright, so here's what I'm actually going to do—I'm marking this as a critical error code CE-9981, which triggers our same-day correction protocol, meaning the $1,547.82 should post back within four hours.
Four hours. Okay. Will it actually... um... stick this time?

I hear the skepticism and honestly, you have every right to doubt this given what happened before. But I'm also—wait, let me just—I'm adding a permanent block on your account against these "system adjustments," code BLOCK-ADJ-7792, so this literally cannot happen again.
That's a thing? You can just... block it?

*exhales* It is, but most reps don't know about it or don't—sorry, they're not trained on it properly, which is honestly frustrating. The block code went live in our system January 15th, but they barely told anyone about it, er, typical communication issues here.
Okay so... four hours. And this block thing is... permanent?

Yes, completely permanent unless you personally call and provide verification code VER-REMOVE-8827 to lift it, which you'd never need to do. And look, I'm putting my direct extension in your file—4789—so if this isn't fixed by, hmm, let's say 2 PM, you call me directly.
You're giving me your actual extension? That's... I mean... they never do that.

Well they should, especially when we've messed up this badly—twice now. I'm also sending you a confirmation email right now with reference number REF-2547-PRIORITY, and that email will show the reversal pending, um, so you have proof for your landlord if needed.
I really appreciate this. You're actually... er... helping. Not just reading a script.

Hey, that's what I'm here for—to actually solve problems, not just apologize for them. Your money will be back by 2 PM, the block is permanent, and if anything seems off, you've got my extension 4789, so, uh, we're going to make sure this nightmare ends today, alright?

scenario: panicked because their account shows a zero balance when it should have money
